Prisma çš„æ ¸å¿ƒä¼˜åŠ¿åœ¨äºå…¶å¼ºå¤§çš„ç±»å‹å®‰å…¨åŠŸèƒ½ï¼Œæ‰€æœ‰çš„æ•°æ®åº“æ“ä½œéƒ½èƒ½é€šè¿‡ Prisma Client æä¾›çš„è‡ªåŠ¨ç”Ÿæˆçš„ç±»å‹æ¥è¿›è¡Œï¼Œè¿™å¤§å¤§å‡å°‘äº†ä»£ç ä¸­çš„é”™è¯¯ï¼Œæå‡äº†å¼€å‘çš„æ•ˆç‡ã€‚å®ƒè¿˜åŒ…å«æ•°æ®åº“è¿ç§»å·¥å…· Prisma Migrate ï¼Œèƒ½å¤Ÿå¸®åŠ©å¼€å‘è€…æ–¹ä¾¿åœ°ç®¡ç†æ•°æ®åº“ç»“æ„çš„å˜åŒ–ã€‚æ­¤å¤–ï¼ŒPrisma Client çš„æŸ¥è¯¢ API å…·æœ‰å¾ˆå¥½çš„æ€§èƒ½ï¼Œèƒ½å¤Ÿé«˜æ•ˆåœ°æ‰§è¡Œå¤æ‚çš„æ•°æ®åº“æŸ¥è¯¢ï¼Œæ”¯æŒåŒ…æ‹¬å…³ç³»æŸ¥è¯¢ã€èšåˆæŸ¥è¯¢ç­‰é«˜çº§åŠŸèƒ½ã€‚

ä¸ä¼ ç»Ÿçš„ ORM ç›¸æ¯”ï¼ŒPrisma ä½¿å¾—æ•°æ®åº“äº¤äº’æ›´åŠ ç®€æ´ä¸”é«˜æ•ˆï¼Œå‡å°‘äº†é…ç½®å’Œæ‰‹åŠ¨æ“ä½œçš„å¤æ‚æ€§ï¼Œç‰¹åˆ«é€‚åˆåœ¨ NestJS é¡¹ç›®ä¸­ä½¿ç”¨ï¼Œèƒ½å¤Ÿä¸ NestJS æä¾›çš„ä¾èµ–æ³¨å…¥å’Œæ¨¡å—åŒ–æ¶æ„å¾ˆå¥½åœ°ç»“åˆï¼Œæå‡æ•´ä½“å¼€å‘ä½“éªŒã€‚

Redis

Redis å’Œ mysql éƒ½ä»…ä»…æ˜¯ä¼šç”¨çš„é˜¶æ®µï¼Œç›®å‰éƒ½æ˜¯ç›´æ¥åœ¨ NestJs é¡¹ç›®ä¸­ä½¿ç”¨ï¼Œéƒ½æ˜¯å·²ç»å°è£…å¥½äº†çš„ï¼Œç›´æ¥ä¼ å‚è°ƒç”¨å°±å¥½äº†ï¼š

import { Injectable, Inject, OnModuleDestroy, Logger } from "@nestjs/common";
import Redis, { ClientContext, Result } from "ioredis";

import { ObjectType } from "../types";

import { isObject } from "@/utils";

@Injectable()
export class RedisService implements OnModuleDestroy {
  private readonly logger = new Logger(RedisService.name);

  constructor(@Inject("REDIS_CLIENT") private readonly redisClient: Redis) {}

  onModuleDestroy(): void {
    this.redisClient.disconnect();
  }

  /**
   * @Description: è®¾ç½®å€¼åˆ° redis ä¸­
   * @param {string} key
   * @param {any} value
   * @return {*}
   */
  public async set(
    key: string,
    value: unknown,
    second?: number
  ): Promise<Result<"OK", ClientContext> | null> {
    try {
      const formattedValue = isObject(value)
        ? JSON.stringify(value)
        : String(value);

      if (!second) {
        return await this.redisClient.set(key, formattedValue);
      } else {
        return await this.redisClient.set(key, formattedValue, "EX", second);
      }
    } catch (error) {
      this.logger.error(`Error setting key ${key} in Redis`, error);

      return null;
    }
  }

  /**
   * @Description: è·å– redis ç¼“å­˜ä¸­çš„å€¼
   * @param key {String}
   */
  public async get(key: string): Promise<string | null> {
    try {
      const data = await this.redisClient.get(key);

      return data ? data : null;
    } catch (error) {
      this.logger.error(`Error getting key ${key} from Redis`, error);

      return null;
    }
  }

  /**
   * @Description: è®¾ç½®è‡ªåŠ¨ +1
   * @param {string} key
   * @return {*}
   */
  public async incr(
    key: string
  ): Promise<Result<number, ClientContext> | null> {
    try {
      return await this.redisClient.incr(key);
    } catch (error) {
      this.logger.error(`Error incrementing key ${key} in Redis`, error);

      return null;
    }
  }

  /**
   * @Description: åˆ é™¤ redis ç¼“å­˜æ•°æ®
   * @param {string} key
   * @return {*}
   */
  public async del(key: string): Promise<Result<number, ClientContext> | null> {
    try {
      return await this.redisClient.del(key);
    } catch (error) {
      this.logger.error(`Error deleting key ${key} from Redis`, error);

      return null;
    }
  }

  /**
   * @Description: è®¾ç½® hash ç»“æ„
   * @param {string} key
   * @param {ObjectType} field
   * @return {*}
   */
  public async hset(
    key: string,
    field: ObjectType
  ): Promise<Result<number, ClientContext> | null> {
    try {
      return await this.redisClient.hset(key, field);
    } catch (error) {
      this.logger.error(`Error setting hash for key ${key} in Redis`, error);

      return null;
    }
  }

  /**
   * @Description: è·å–å•ä¸ª hash å€¼
   * @param {string} key
   * @param {string} field
   * @return {*}
   */
  public async hget(key: string, field: string): Promise<string | null> {
    try {
      return await this.redisClient.hget(key, field);
    } catch (error) {
      this.logger.error(
        `Error getting hash field ${field} from key ${key} in Redis`,
        error
      );

      return null;
    }
  }

  /**
   * @Description: è·å–æ‰€æœ‰ hash å€¼
   * @param {string} key
   * @return {*}
   */
  public async hgetall(key: string): Promise<Record<string, string> | null> {
    try {
      return await this.redisClient.hgetall(key);
    } catch (error) {
      this.logger.error(
        `Error getting all hash fields from key ${key} in Redis`,
        error
      );

      return null;
    }
  }

  /**
   * @Description: æ¸…ç©º redis ç¼“å­˜
   * @return {*}
   */
  public async flushall(): Promise<Result<"OK", ClientContext> | null> {
    try {
      return await this.redisClient.flushall();
    } catch (error) {
      this.logger.error("Error flushing all Redis data", error);

      return null;
    }
  }

  /**
   * @Description: ä¿å­˜ç¦»çº¿é€šçŸ¥
   * @param {string} userId
   * @param {any} notification
   */
  public async saveOfflineNotification(
    userId: string,
    notification: any
  ): Promise<void> {
    try {
      await this.redisClient.lpush(
        `offline_notifications:${userId}`,
        JSON.stringify(notification)
      );
    } catch (error) {
      this.logger.error(
        `Error saving offline notification for user ${userId}`,
        error
      );
    }
  }

  /**
   * @Description: è·å–ç¦»çº¿é€šçŸ¥
   * @param {string} userId
   * @return {*}
   */
  public async getOfflineNotifications(userId: string): Promise<any[]> {
    try {
      const notifications = await this.redisClient.lrange(
        `offline_notifications:${userId}`,
        0,
        -1
      );
      await this.redisClient.del(`offline_notifications:${userId}`);

      return notifications.map((notification) => JSON.parse(notification));
    } catch (error) {
      this.logger.error(
        `Error getting offline notifications for user ${userId}`,
        error
      );

      return [];
    }
  }

  /**
   * è·å–æŒ‡å®š key çš„å‰©ä½™ç”Ÿå­˜æ—¶é—´
   * @param key Redis key
   * @returns å‰©ä½™ç”Ÿå­˜æ—¶é—´ï¼ˆç§’ï¼‰
   */
  public async getTTL(key: string): Promise<number> {
    return await this.redisClient.ttl(key);
  }
}

Join us in leading the innovations in decentralized finance WOO democratizes access to top-tier liquidity and exceptional trading execution while keeping costs competitive. We take pride in our two platforms WOO X, a pioneering crypto exchange dedicated to transparency and trustworthiness, and WOOFi, a top 15 DEX by 24-hour volume. Our native token, $WOO offers token holders a unique position to participate, engage, and maximize the benefits of both the DeFi and CeFi ecosystem. Our team of highly-selected 170 employees works from 12 cities across eight countries in Europe and Asia ğŸš€

AI Team çš„å¸–å­é“¾æ¥ https://www.v2ex.com/t/1098320?p=1#reply6

[ 5 ã€QA Engineer ]

What youâ€™ll be working on:

Maintaining and improving the testing process to ensure the quality of the production system.

Gathering and analysing testing requirements, planning the testing process, and producing concrete testing plans and test cases.

Assisting with the API testing.

Being actively involved in requirements review, test case design, quality assurance, function launching, and issue tracking.

About you:

Background in finance/financial trading systems, such as FIX protocol, ordering process, derivatives trading, etc. will be a plus.

Experienced in testing Mobile apps and Web development is a plus.

Proficient in QA methodology with the ability to execute test cases and review results, reporting and documenting technical issues.

Capable to review and analyze system specifications.

Familiar with project management tools like Jira and Testlink.

Familiar with MySQL database.

Familiar with API testing and network traffic analysis tools or IP Tools.

Experience in automation testing using Python and JavaScript.

Enjoy breaking things and solving problems - not just being able to find out the â€˜whatâ€™, but also the â€˜whyâ€™.

Excellent troubleshooting, listening, and problem-solving skills with the ability to set project expectations and meet deadlines.

Ability to work in a fast-paced, multi-task environment.

Possess excellent communication skills, attention to detail, analytical mind, problem-solving aptitude, and strong organisational skills.

[ 6 ã€Senior Backend Engineer (Java)]

What youâ€™ll be working on:

Developing the core functions of the trading platform and building the technology infrastructure that supports digital asset trading on the Internet;

Implementing RestFul and WebSocket API interfaces to support customers in receiving market data and executing orders;

Establishing a robust, efficient, and concurrent trading system to ensure 7x24 hours of uninterrupted operation;

Actively conducting efficient communication with the product team and business development team to collect requirements and participate in product planning and system design;

Proposing practical and feasible solutions and producing technical documents independently.

Our tech stack: Java, Spring Boot, Spring Cloud, Gradle, Kubernetes, etc.

About you:

BSc/MSc in Computer Science, Engineering, or a relevant field;

At least 5+ years of proven hands-on experience with JVM language (preferably Java); Solid experience with any relational database;

Solid experience with messaging systems (e.g. RocketMq, Kafka);

Hands-on experience in building service-oriented applications;

Experience with Kubernetes and Linux;

Good to have experience with performance tuning and GitLab;

Good to have experience in developing fintech/trading-related web applications; Excellent communication skills and fluent English.

[ 7 ã€Senior Frontend Engineer ]

What youâ€™ll be working on:

Developing WOO X web products that support digital asset trading. Participating in building up innovative tools to enrich the ecosystem of our products. Optimising the process of development, performance and user experience continuously. Why work with us:

About you:

Minimum of 3 years of frontend development experience and familiarity with React.js. Proficient in JavaScript, CSS, HTML and ES6. Familiar with real-time data processing methods, such as Websocket and RxJs, and able to detect potential performance issues. Knowledge of blockchain/crypto service or expertise in the online blockchain/crypto industry is a BIG plus. You enjoy breaking things and solving problems - not just being able to find out the 'what', but also the 'why'. Excellent troubleshooting, listening and problem-solving skills with the ability to set project expectations and meet deadlines. Ability to work in a fast-paced, multi-task environment.

[ 8 ã€Senior DevOps Engineer ] å¤§æ•°æ®è¿ç»´

What youâ€™ll be working on:

Monitoring our exchange service status, refining the deployment pipeline, monitoring, troubleshooting and identifying the root cause of issues.

Focusing on ensuring the stability of the service and helping the Engineering team to deploy features to production.

Handling and solving issues when service goes wrong.

Designing a better deployment pipeline.

Building tools to monitor systems and identify issues.

About you:

(Must) Familiar with one of the IaC tools such as Terraform or Ansible.

(Must) Familiar with one of the cloud providers such as GCP, AWS or Azure.

(Must) Familiar with Kubernetes, Helm and Docker Familiar with one of GitOps such as ArgoCD.

Familiar with one of the monitoring systems such as Prometheus and Grafana.

Familiar with one of the logging systems Loki or ELK.

Familiar with one of MQ tools such as RocketMQ Familiar with one of the cache tools such as Redis.

Familiar with one of SQL/NoSQL databases such as MySQL or Mongo.

Familiar with one of the programming languages such as Python or Golang.

Nice to have! - Security-related experience.

24/7 on-call when there are urgent issues to handle and must be handled in a timely + a responsible manner.

Knowledge of the blockchain/crypto domain or expertise in the online blockchain/crypto industry is a BIG plus.

Excellent troubleshooting, listening and problem-solving skills with the ability to set project expectations and meet deadlines.

Ability to work in a fast-paced, multi-task environment.

[ 9 ã€Senior Product Manager ]

What youâ€™ll be working on:

Leading the end-to-end product lifecycle for exchange platform features, such as KYC processes, fiat integrations, and CRM tools, from concept to launch and continuous improvement.

Collaborating with engineering, design, compliance, and operational teams to define and implement product requirements that balance user needs with business objectives and regulatory compliance.

Driving user research and market analysis to identify pain points and opportunities in areas like registration, deposits, withdrawals, and administrative workflows, delivering innovative solutions that improve the overall user experience.

Creating and managing a clear product roadmap for platform-wide features and internal tools, ensuring alignment with business goals and customer expectations.

Optimizing and scaling operational workflows through robust internal tools to improve efficiency for support and admin teams.

Analyzing product performance using data-driven insights to identify opportunities for iteration and enhancements.

Staying updated on regulatory and industry trends to ensure all solutions remain compliant and competitive in the evolving cryptocurrency and exchange landscape.

Promoting collaboration, clear communication, and agile execution across teams to ensure timely delivery of impactful product solutions.

About you:

6+ years of product management experience with a focus on crypto exchange platforms. Proven experience in developing and launching core platform features, especially those related to KYC, fiat integrations, CRM, or back-office systems.

Strong understanding of cryptocurrency exchanges, blockchain technology, and the regulatory landscape in the crypto space.

Familiarity with user onboarding flows and operational workflows, with a keen eye for process optimization and user experience improvements.

Experience working in fast-paced, agile environments and managing cross-functional teams effectively.

Data-driven approach to product development, with a strong ability to use metrics and analytics tools to inform decisions.

Proficiency in product management methodologies (e.g., Agile, Scrum) and tools. Excellent communication, collaboration, and presentation skills, with fluency in English (C1+).

Startup mindset with a focus on innovation, adaptability, and problem-solving.

def test(request):
    from django_q.tasks import async_task, result
    info = {'code': 0, 'data': [], 'msg': ''}
    try:
        task_ids = []
        for i in range(700):
            task_id = async_task(my_function, i)  
            task_ids.append(task_id)
    except:
        info['msg'] = 'test error'
        logger.error(traceback.format_exc())
    return JsonResponse(info, safe=False)

item.content:encoded:
https://blog.bitnami.com/2024/11/bitnami-premium.html

Starting December 10th 2024, only the latest stable branch of any container will receive updates in the free Bitnami catalog. To access up-to-date releases for all upstream-supported branches, consider upgrading to Bitnami Premium. Previous versions already released will not be deleted. They are still available to pull from DockerHub.

item.content:encoded:
æˆ‘ä»¬æ˜¯ä¸€å®¶ web3 çš„åˆ›ä¸šå…¬å¸ï¼Œéœ€è¦ä¸€ä½æŠ€æœ¯ leader ã€‚å²—ä½æœ€å¥½ base ç¾å›½ï¼Œæˆ–è€…ä»¥ç¾å›½æ—¶åŒºå·¥ä½œã€‚ä»¥ä¸‹æ˜¯å²—ä½ä»‹ç»ï¼š
Head of Engineering
Weâ€™re seeking an experienced Head of Engineering to lead and drive our technical teams, focusing on cutting-edge infrastructure development in the blockchain space. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of p2p networks, L1/L2 architectures, and be fluent in multiple programming languages. You will be responsible for overseeing engineering projects, building scalable systems, and ensuring high-quality code delivery. This role requires strong leadership skills and the ability to communicate effectively across teams.

Responsibilities:
- Lead and manage engineering teams, ensuring technical excellence and alignment with company goals
- Design and develop scalable and performant p2p networks and blockchain architectures, with a focus on L1/L2 solutions
- Oversee the implementation of key infrastructure features in Rust, Go, and Typescript
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive technical initiatives and product roadmap execution
- Ensure the architecture and infrastructure are scalable, maintainable, and secure
- Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement within the engineering team
- Communicate effectively with stakeholders to ensure alignment between engineering and business objectives

Requirements:
- 5+ years of engineering experience, with at least 3 years in leadership or engineering management roles
- Fluency with p2p networks, particularly using libp2p, and strong knowledge of L1/L2 blockchain architectures
- Expertise in Rust, Go, and Typescript development
- Strong engineering management experience, including team building, project management, and mentoring
- Excellent communication skills, able to articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
- Proven track record of delivering high-quality engineering solutions in a fast-paced environment
- Highly organized with a strong focus on proces

# æ•°æ®åº“åˆå§‹çŠ¶æ€
TRUNCATE account;
INSERT INTO account (id, name, balance, version)
VALUES (1, 'ichigo', 10, 1),
       (2, 'rukia', 10, 1);

# å¹¶å‘äº‹åŠ¡ 1 è½¬å‡ºå…¨éƒ¨ä½™é¢
START TRANSACTION;
SELECT balance, version FROM account WHERE id = 1;
SELECT version FROM account WHERE id = 2;
UPDATE account SET balance = balance - 10, version = 2 WHERE id = 1 AND version = 1;
UPDATE account SET balance = balance + 10, version = 2 WHERE id = 2 AND version = 1;
COMMIT;

# å¹¶å‘äº‹åŠ¡ 2 å–å‡ºå…¨éƒ¨ä½™é¢

ä¸ä½¿ç”¨ Maven/Gradle, åªä½¿ç”¨ javac

  • å…¨éƒ¨ä»£ç æ‰ 11KB, å°±ç®—åŠ ä¸Š README ä¹‹ç±»çš„æ–‡ä»¶æ•´ä¸ªé¡¹ç›®ä¸å‹ç¼©ä¹Ÿåªæœ‰ 30KB
  • åªä½¿ç”¨ Java æ ‡å‡†åº“ï¼Œå®Œå…¨æ²¡æœ‰ç¬¬ä¸‰æ–¹ä»£ç ï¼Œä¿®æ”¹ä»£ç ååªéœ€è¦ä½¿ç”¨ javac ç¼–è¯‘å³å¯ï¼Œç›¸å…³çš„å‘½ä»¤æˆ‘ä¹Ÿæä¾›äº†ï¼Œå…·ä½“è¯·çœ‹é¡¹ç›® README ã€‚

ä¸€éƒ¨åˆ†ä»£ç 

ä¸‹é¢æ˜¯ä¸»ç•Œé¢ class Main çš„å…¨éƒ¨ä»£ç ï¼š

public class Main implements Runnable {
    private ScrollArea scrollArea;

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        MyUtil.checkProjectExists();
        SwingUtilities.invokeLater(new Main());
    }

    public void run() {
        // ä¸»çª—å£
        JFrame frame = new JFrame();
        frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);

        // ç¨‹åºæ ‡é¢˜
        JPanel mainPanel = new JPanel();
        JLabel labelTitle = new JLabel("Wuliu Simple Text Note");
        mainPanel.add(labelTitle);

        // æ–‡æœ¬æ¡†
        scrollArea = new ScrollArea();
        mainPanel.add(scrollArea.scrollPane());

        JLabel spacer = new JLabel(" ".repeat(150));
        mainPanel.add(spacer);
        
        // æäº¤æŒ‰é’®
        JButton okButton = new JButton("OK");
        okButton.addActionListener(new OkButtonListener());
        mainPanel.add(okButton);

        frame.add(BorderLayout.CENTER, mainPanel);
        frame.setSize(500, 400);
        frame.setLocationRelativeTo(null); // çª—å£å±…ä¸­
        frame.setVisible(true);
    }

    // æŒ‰é’®è§¦å‘äº‹ä»¶ï¼šè·å–æ–‡æœ¬æ¡†å†…å®¹ï¼Œç”Ÿæˆæ–‡ä»¶ æˆ– å‘æ–‡ä»¶æ·»åŠ å†…å®¹
    class OkButtonListener implements ActionListener {
        @Override
        public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
            String text = scrollArea.textArea().getText().trim();
            try {
                MyUtil.createNoteToday(text);
            } catch (IOException ex) {
                System.err.println("ERROR! ERROR!");
                throw new RuntimeException(ex);
            }
            System.exit(0);
        }
    }
}

ä»¥ä¸Šå°±æ˜¯ä¸»ç¨‹åºçš„å…¨éƒ¨ä»£ç ï¼Œå¦å¤–è¿˜æœ‰ä¸¤ä¸ªæ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œæ¯”å¦‚ MyUtil.java, æ±‡æ€»ä¸€äº›å‡½æ•°ï¼Œ ä»¥ä¾¿è®©ä¸»ç¨‹åºçœ‹èµ·æ¥ç®€æ´ã€‚ åæ­£å°±æ˜¯ä»£ç å¾ˆå°‘ï¼ŒåŠŸèƒ½ä¹Ÿå¾ˆç®€å•ï¼Œä½†å¾ˆå®ç”¨ã€‚

item.title: [Python] æœ‰ä»€ä¹ˆå¥½åŠæ³•é™åˆ¶ Python çš„å†…å­˜åˆ†é…å—ï¼Ÿ

è¿™æ˜¯ä¸€æ®µä¼šåƒæ‰å‡ ä¹æ‰€æœ‰å¯ç”¨å†…å­˜çš„ä»£ç ï¼š

def Decompress_Gzip_With_Progress_Bar(gzip_path, output_path):
    with gzip.open(gzip_path, 'rb') as f_in:
        with open(output_path, 'wb') as f_out:
            file_size = Get_Uncompressed_Size(gzip_path)
            chunk_size = 1024 * 1024
            with tqdm(total=file_size, unit='B', unit_scale=True, desc="Decompressing " + gzip_path) as pbar:
                for block in iter(lambda: f_in.read(chunk_size), b''):
                    f_out.write(block)
                    pbar.update(len(block))

item.title: [macOS] iTerm2 ç”¨æˆ·è¯·å‡çº§
item.content:encoded:
å‡†å¤‡æ¢å›åŸç”Ÿç»ˆç«¯äº†ï½

https://iterm2.com/downloads/stable/iTerm2-3_5_11.changelog

You may be affected if you used the SSH
integration feature in any of the following
versions:

* 3.5.6
* 3.5.7
* 3.5.8
* 3.5.9
* 3.5.10
* Any beta versions of 3.5.6 and later.

What is the issue?
------------------
A bug in the SSH integration feature caused input
and output to be logged to a file on the remote
host. This file, /tmp/framer.txt, may be readable
by other users on the remote host.

function App() {
  const [num, setNum] = useState(100)
  window.__setNum = setNum
  return <Comp num={num}></Comp>
}

function Comp(props) {

    debugger
    props // {num:1000}
    return () => {
      debugger
      // ä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆè¿™é‡Œæ˜¯æ—§çš„ props? {num:100}
      props
    }
  }, [props.num])

    </p>
  )
}

setTimeout(() => {
  __setNum(1000)
}, 1000)
